body:
![build](https://github.com/R-unic/cosmo/actions/workflows/crystal.yml/badge.svg) # Cosmo Cosmo is a statically-typed programming language written in pure Crystal.
We have an [extension for VS code](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=cosmo.vscode-cosmo) ([source](https://github.com/R-unic/vscode-cosmo)), however it currently only features syntax highlighting. ## Things I Gotta Do - Arrays - Some sorta hashmap - Interfaces - Classes * single inheritance * mixins * visibilities * methods * $ (this) - Better type system * use TypeChecker for all operators * unions/intersections * aliasing ## Installation 1. Install [Crystal](https://crystal-lang.org/install/). 2. Run `sudo make install`. 3. Assert everything is working by running `cosmo -h` ## Contributing 1. Fork it () 2. Create your feature branch (`git checkout -b my-new-feature`) 3. Commit your changes (`git commit -am 'Add some feature'`) 4. Test your code (`make test`) 5. Push to the branch (`make publish`) 6. Create a new Pull Request ## Contributors - [R-unic](https://github.com/R-unic) - creator and maintainer

instance_methods.name: read_file
instance_methods.doc: Reads a file at `path` and returns it's contents
instance_methods.summary: Reads a file at path and returns it's contents

def.name: read_file
def.body:
begin
  contents = File.read(path)
  read_source(contents, file_path: path)
rescue ex : Exception
  abort("Failed to read file \"#{path}\": \n#{ex.message}\n\t#{ex.backtrace.join("\n\t")}", 1)
end

instance_methods.name: run_repl
instance_methods.doc: Starts the REPL
instance_methods.summary: Starts the REPL

def.name: run_repl
def.body:
puts("Welcome to the Cosmo REPL")
loop do
  line = read_line
  if line.nil?
    break
  end
  puts(read_source(line, file_path: "repl"))
end

instance_methods.name: to_s
instance_methods.doc:
Returns a nicely readable and concise string representation of this object,
typically intended for users.

This method should usually **not** be overridden. It delegates to
`#to_s(IO)` which can be overridden for custom implementations.

Also see `#inspect`.
instance_methods.summary: Returns a nicely readable and concise string representation of this object, typically intended for users.

instance_methods.name: single_expression
instance_methods.doc:
It yields itself for any node, but if it's a
`Statement::ExpressionList`, then it returns the
first node of the `ExpressionList` statement
instance_methods.summary: It yields itself for any node, but if it's a Statement::ExpressionList, then it returns the first node of the ExpressionList statement

instance_methods.name: single_expression?
instance_methods.doc:
It yields `nil` always for any regular node.
(It is overridden by `ExpressionList` to implement `#single_expression`.)
instance_methods.summary: It yields nil always for any regular node.

instance_methods.name: single_expression?
instance_methods.doc: It yields first node if this holds only one node, or yields `nil`.
instance_methods.summary: It yields first node if this holds only one node, or yields nil.

def.name: single_expression?
def.body:
if @nodes.size == 1
  expr = @nodes.first.single_expression
  if expr.is_a?(Statement::SingleExpression)
    expr.expression
  else
    expr.as(Expression::Base)
  end
else
  nil
end

constructors.name: new
constructors.args_string: (identifier : Cosmo::Token, parameters : Array(Cosmo::AST::Expression::Parameter), body : Cosmo::AST::Statement::Block, return_typedef : Cosmo::Token)

def.name: new
def.body:
_ = allocate
_.initialize(identifier, parameters, body, return_typedef)
if _.responds_to?(:finalize)
  ::GC.add_finalizer(_)
end
_

def.name: call
def.body:
scope = Scope.new(@closure)
@definition.parameters.each_with_index do |param, i|
  scope.declare(param.typedef, param.identifier, args[i])
end
result = nil
begin
  result = @interpreter.execute_block(@definition.body, scope)
rescue returner : Return
  result = returner.value
end
result

instance_methods.name: to_s
instance_methods.doc:
Returns a nicely readable and concise string representation of this object,
typically intended for users.

This method should usually **not** be overridden. It delegates to
`#to_s(IO)` which can be overridden for custom implementations.

Also see `#inspect`.
instance_methods.summary: Returns a nicely readable and concise string representation of this object, typically intended for users.

def.name: execute_block
def.body:
prev_scope = @scope
begin
  @scope = block_scope
  if block.nodes.empty?
  else
    return_node = block.nodes.find do |node|
      node.is_a?(Statement::Return)
    end || block.nodes.last
    body_nodes = block.nodes[0..-2]
    body_nodes.each do |expr|
      execute(expr.as(Statement::Base))
    end
    if return_node.nil?
    else
      return_value = execute(return_node.as(Statement::Base))
    end
  end
  return_type = @meta["block_return_type"] || "void"
  token = return_node.nil? ? Token.new(Syntax::None, nil, Location.new("", 0, 0)) : return_node.token
  TypeChecker.assert(return_type, return_value, token)
  return_value
rescue ex : Exception
  raise(ex)
ensure
  @scope = prev_scope
end

def.name: interpret
def.body:
@file_path = file_path
parser = Parser.new(source, @file_path)
statements = parser.parse
if @output_ast
  puts(statements.map(&.to_s))
end
result = nil
statements.each do |stmt|
  result = execute(stmt)
end
result

def.name: visit_binary_op_expr
def.body:
left = evaluate(expr.left.as(Expression::Base))
right = evaluate(expr.right.as(Expression::Base))
case expr.operator.type
when Syntax::Plus
  if left.is_a?(Float)
    if right.is_a?(Float)
      left + right
    else
      if right.is_a?(Int)
        left + right.to_f
      else
        report_error("Invalid '+' operand type", right.class.to_s, expr.operator)
      end
    end
  else
    if left.is_a?(Int)
      if right.is_a?(Int)
        left + right
      else
        if right.is_a?(Float)
          left.to_f + right
        else
          report_error("Invalid '+' operand type", right.class.to_s, expr.operator)
        end
      end
    else
      if left.is_a?(String)
        if right.is_a?(String)
          left + right
        else
          report_error("Invalid '+' operand type", right.class.to_s, expr.operator)
        end
      else
        report_error("Invalid '+' operand type", left.class.to_s, expr.operator)
      end
    end
  end
when Syntax::Minus
  if left.is_a?(Float)
    if right.is_a?(Float)
      left - right
    else
      if right.is_a?(Int)
        left - right.to_f
      else
        report_error("Invalid '-' operand type", right.class.to_s, expr.operator)
      end
    end
  else
    if left.is_a?(Int)
      if right.is_a?(Int)
        left - right
      else
        if right.is_a?(Float)
          left.to_f - right
        else
          report_error("Invalid '-' operand type", right.class.to_s, expr.operator)
        end
      end
    else
      report_error("Invalid '-' operand type", left.class.to_s, expr.operator)
    end
  end
when Syntax::Star
  if left.is_a?(Float)
    if right.is_a?(Float)
      left * right
    else
      if right.is_a?(Int)
        left * right.to_f
      else
        report_error("Invalid '*' operand type", right.class.to_s, expr.operator)
      end
    end
  else
    if left.is_a?(Int)
      if right.is_a?(Int)
        left * right
      else
        if right.is_a?(Float)
          left.to_f * right
        else
          report_error("Invalid '*' operand type", right.class.to_s, expr.operator)
        end
      end
    else
      report_error("Invalid '*' operand type", left.class.to_s, expr.operator)
    end
  end
when Syntax::Slash
  if left.is_a?(Float)
    if right.is_a?(Float)
      left / right
    else
      if right.is_a?(Int)
        left / right.to_f
      else
        report_error("Invalid '/' operand type", right.class.to_s, expr.operator)
      end
    end
  else
    if left.is_a?(Int)
      if right.is_a?(Int)
        left / right
      else
        if right.is_a?(Float)
          left.to_f / right
        else
          report_error("Invalid '/' operand type", right.class.to_s, expr.operator)
        end
      end
    else
      report_error("Invalid '/' operand type", left.class.to_s, expr.operator)
    end
  end
when Syntax::Carat
  if left.is_a?(Float)
    if right.is_a?(Float)
      left ** right
    else
      if right.is_a?(Int)
        left ** right.to_f
      else
        report_error("Invalid '^' operand type", right.class.to_s, expr.operator)
      end
    end
  else
    if left.is_a?(Int)
      if right.is_a?(Int)
        left ** right
      else
        if right.is_a?(Float)
          left.to_f ** right
        else
          report_error("Invalid '^' operand type", right.class.to_s, expr.operator)
        end
      end
    else
      report_error("Invalid '^' operand type", left.class.to_s, expr.operator)
    end
  end
when Syntax::Percent
  if left.is_a?(Float)
    if right.is_a?(Float)
      left % right
    else
      if right.is_a?(Int)
        left % right.to_f
      else
        report_error("Invalid '%' operand type", right.class.to_s, expr.operator)
      end
    end
  else
    if left.is_a?(Int)
      if right.is_a?(Int)
        left % right
      else
        if right.is_a?(Float)
          left.to_f % right
        else
          report_error("Invalid '%' operand type", right.class.to_s, expr.operator)
        end
      end
    else
      report_error("Invalid '%' operand type", left.class.to_s, expr.operator)
    end
  end
when Syntax::Ampersand
  left && right
when Syntax::Pipe
  left || right
when Syntax::EqualEqual
  left == right
when Syntax::BangEqual
  left != right
when Syntax::Less
  if left.is_a?(Float)
    if right.is_a?(Float)
      left < right
    else
      if right.is_a?(Int)
        left < right.to_f
      else
        report_error("Invalid '<' operand type", right.class.to_s, expr.operator)
      end
    end
  else
    if left.is_a?(Int)
      if right.is_a?(Int)
        left < right
      else
        if right.is_a?(Float)
          left.to_f < right
        else
          report_error("Invalid '<' operand type", right.class.to_s, expr.operator)
        end
      end
    else
      report_error("Invalid '<' operand type", left.class.to_s, expr.operator)
    end
  end
when Syntax::LessEqual
  if left.is_a?(Float)
    if right.is_a?(Float)
      left <= right
    else
      if right.is_a?(Int)
        left <= right.to_f
      else
        report_error("Invalid '<=' operand type", right.class.to_s, expr.operator)
      end
    end
  else
    if left.is_a?(Int)
      if right.is_a?(Int)
        left <= right
      else
        if right.is_a?(Float)
          left.to_f <= right
        else
          report_error("Invalid '<=' operand type", right.class.to_s, expr.operator)
        end
      end
    else
      report_error("Invalid '<=' operand type", left.class.to_s, expr.operator)
    end
  end
when Syntax::Greater
  if left.is_a?(Float)
    if right.is_a?(Float)
      left > right
    else
      if right.is_a?(Int)
        left > right.to_f
      else
        report_error("Invalid '>' operand type", right.class.to_s, expr.operator)
      end
    end
  else
    if left.is_a?(Int)
      if right.is_a?(Int)
        left > right
      else
        if right.is_a?(Float)
          left.to_f > right
        else
          report_error("Invalid '>' operand type", right.class.to_s, expr.operator)
        end
      end
    else
      report_error("Invalid '>' operand type", left.class.to_s, expr.operator)
    end
  end
when Syntax::GreaterEqual
  if left.is_a?(Float)
    if right.is_a?(Float)
      left >= right
    else
      if right.is_a?(Int)
        left >= right.to_f
      else
        report_error("Invalid '>=' operand type", right.class.to_s, expr.operator)
      end
    end
  else
    if left.is_a?(Int)
      if right.is_a?(Int)
        left >= right
      else
        if right.is_a?(Float)
          left.to_f >= right
        else
          report_error("Invalid '>=' operand type", right.class.to_s, expr.operator)
        end
      end
    else
      report_error("Invalid '>=' operand type", left.class.to_s, expr.operator)
    end
  end
end

def.name: visit_compound_assignment_expr
visit_fn_call_expr
visit_fn_def_stmt
visit_unary_op_expr
def.body:
operand = evaluate(expr.operand.as(Expression::Base))
case expr.operator.type
when Syntax::Plus
  if operand.is_a?(Float) || operand.is_a?(Int)
    operand.abs
  else
    report_error("Invalid '+' operand type", operand.class.to_s, expr.operator)
  end
when Syntax::Minus
  if operand.is_a?(Float) || operand.is_a?(Int)
    -operand
  else
    report_error("Invalid '-' operand type", operand.class.to_s, expr.operator)
  end
when Syntax::Bang
  !operand
when Syntax::Star
  raise("'*' unary operator has not yet implemented.")
when Syntax::Hashtag
  raise("'#' unary operator has not yet implemented.")
end

instance_methods.name: to_s
instance_methods.doc:
Returns a nicely readable and concise string representation of this object,
typically intended for users.

This method should usually **not** be overridden. It delegates to

def.name: between?
def.body:
if min && max
else
  return false
end
min <= self && self <= max

instance_methods.name: parse
instance_methods.doc: Entry point
instance_methods.summary: Entry point

def.name: parse
def.body:
statements = [] of Statement::Base
while !finished?
  statements << parse_statement
end
statements

constructors.name: new
constructors.args_string: (value : Bool | Char | Cosmo::Callable | Float32 | Float64 | Int16 | Int32 | Int64 | Int8 | String | Nil, token : Token)
constructors.args_html: (value : Bool | Char | Cosmo::Callable | Float32 | Float64 | Int16 | Int32 | Int64 | Int8 | String | Nil, token : Token)

def.name: assign
declare
lookup
def.body:
identifier = token.value
if @variables.has_key?(identifier)
  typedef, value = @variables[identifier]
  return value
else
  if @parent.nil?
  else
    parent = @parent.not_nil!
    value = parent.lookup(token)
    return value
  end
end
if (typedef.nil? && value.nil?) && @parent.nil?
  Logger.report_error("Undefined variable", token.value.to_s, token)
end

def.name: lookup_at
def.body:
var_decl : Tuple(String, ValueType) = (ancestor(distance)).variables[token.value.to_s]?
typedef, value = var_decl
value

instance_methods.name: to_s
instance_methods.doc:
Returns a nicely readable and concise string representation of this object,
typically intended for users.

This method should usually **not** be overridden. It delegates to
`#to_s(IO)` which can be overridden for custom implementations.

Also see `#inspect`.
instance_methods.summary: Returns a nicely readable and concise string representation of this object, typically intended for users.

constants.name: TYPE_MAP
constants.value: {Int64 => "int", Int32 => "int", Int16 => "int", Int8 => "int", Float64 => "float", Float32 => "float", String => "string", Char => "char", Bool => "bool", Nil => "none", Function => "fn", PutsIntrinsic => "fn"}

def.name: assert
def.body:
case typedef
when "fn"
  if value.is_a?(Function) || value.is_a?(IntrinsicFunction)
  else
    report_mismatch(typedef, value, token)
  end
when "int"
  if value.is_a?(Int)
  else
    report_mismatch(typedef, value, token)
  end
when "float"
  if value.is_a?(Float)
  else
    report_mismatch(typedef, value, token)
  end
when "bool"
  if value.is_a?(Bool)
  else
    report_mismatch(typedef, value, token)
  end
when "string"
  if value.is_a?(String)
  else
    report_mismatch(typedef, value, token)
  end
when "char"
  if value.is_a?(Char)
  else
    report_mismatch(typedef, value, token)
  end
when "none", "void"
  if value == nil
  else
    report_mismatch(typedef, value, token)
  end
when "any"
else
  raise("Unhandled type '#{typedef}' in TypeChecker")
end
